Reviews.Title: “First visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: transatlantics
Reviews.Content: Great location: near train station (easy walking distance to hotel if you only have carry on), near buses (please ask receptionists how to get to places: once you figure the numbers out it is pretty much straight forward). Very modern, very clean and a good continental breakfast. Not to forget the wonderful lady who made us every morning a cappuccino and did also the housekeeping: always happy and smiling: a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LauMah
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and just love it. Desk reception staff are so friendly and helpful. Rooms are classy and clean. Rome is expensive but I think you get good value here. Breakfast is great, continental style, with a delicious cappuccino to start your day atop the rooftop terrace. I don't really find the rooms that small. It's Europe, so I don't expect a sitting area and a big desk. Good air-conditioning and a little fridge. No wi-fi. 10 min walk to Trevi. 15 min from Termini. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hip modern hotel at the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: Sammytay
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights after a business trip and the hotel was a great 3 star hotel in the centre of rome's opera distict. Rooms were modern and clean but very tight and small as expected of a 3 star european hotel. Staff were very friendly and theres a nice roof top area where breakfast is served and included in the room rate. Highly recommended and great value for money too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwcarmichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for three nights and this little Italian hotel was absolutely wonderful. The service was excellent and the room very inviting. The restoration was great and decoration very inviting modern Itanian. The location was great and we would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “opera hotel not that great”
Reviews.Author: Deborah W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel largely on the basis of the reviews we read on this site and elsewhere, but we were somewhat disappointed. The room was not clean, garbage from the previous guests was still there. It is extremely small and the elevator only holds one person and one bag, if you squeeze in. The bed was reasonably comfortable and the staff was helpful although we had to wait over an hour at the airport for our prearranged ride. The best part of the stay was the breakfast in the lovely roof garden.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but inattention to details and no a/c”
Reviews.Author: ladylawyer42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera Hotel for just one night before leaving for home. The good points: the room was small, but nicely laid-out. The bathroom was a decent size, with marble and travertine floors and walls. The bed was comfortable, and the linens crisp. The television was a flat screen attached to the wall opposite the bed. The breakfast room was nice, and the lady running it was extremely pleasant and cheerful. The bad points: there was no ventilation whatsoever except for opening the window. The traffic noise was so loud with the window open that we could not hear television at all. There was a loud band playing on the street corner outside the hotel. The receptionist tried to get the a/c to turn on, but after multiple tries and a call to her boss, reported that the a/c could not be turned on because "it's winter." We could not even get the fan to run. This was a very warm October day, and the room was quite hot. We had to open the window and also prop open the hallway door for about 2 hours to get the room to a bearable temperature. We closed it in order to sleep, and by morning the room was again uncomfortably warm. The bathroom had not been properly cleaned prior to our arrival: there was trash still in the wastebasket, and the toilet had not been cleaned. The vanity lights above the sink did not work, and also one light next to the bed did not work. The shower head was clogged, so the water sprayed out in various directions. Overall, I would not choose this hotel again. There were some good points, but the numerous issues in just a one night stay would send me elsewhere on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelly7612
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Opera Hotel. Our room was nice, I had concerns about the room being dark but we didn't find that to be the case. I liked the modern decoration of the hotel and our room. It seemed to us that they need to spend a little bit of money to bring the hotel back to it's original opening state. There just seemed to be quite a few little things that went wrong. The 1st floor elevator button was broken for a few days. The phones were out for a few days. Our shower didn't drain, you had to stop in the middle of the shower to avoid and overflow. The showerhead was blocked. The electricity didn't work in all of the plugs. There were burnt out lights in the room. Nothing major but enough to see that maintenance is needed. The front desk staff were excellent. They advised us of the best times to head to places, they recommended great restarurants and were very helpful with directions. The woman in charge of cleaning our room was great and super nice. I was sick one day and she wanted to make sure we had clean towels so she sent them up with my husband after breakfast. I highly recommed the breakfast, it's plentiful and good. Taking breakfast eliminates having to find it in the morning, one less thing to think of and it's great food. One note, they have quite a computer system at the hotel, very detailed and I felt uneasy about exactly what they can control from the front desk. They can tell if the bathroom door is locked from the front desk turn on/off the heat, regulate the room temperature, monitor the lights etc. It just made me a bit uncomfortable. The hotel is located close to everything, we walked most places, took the bus and subway to the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: graceswan96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night after we got back from our cruise. The reviews I had read before my stay on Trip Advisor are all correct. Very nice clean rooms. Friendly staff. Nice enough breakfast, just pastries, cereal, cheese and cold cuts, coffee and juice, but that is basically a continental breakfast. The 5th floor where the breakfast is served is beautiful. We walked across the street to a neighborhood market for pastries the night before, and they have enough items to buy a light dinner/lunch from there. The door to the hotel looks like you are going into the shops around it, and you do have to walk up a flight of stairs to get to the first floor. Also, the elevator is tiny, barely fit our luggage. Room was very nice and bed was comfy. We did walk to a few shops and around the corner to dinner. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: AMMI
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in 2007 & chose to bring my husband back here last month. It was awesome! You've read in other reviews, so this is just to recap: Location is mere blocks from train station, Forum, and all the other major sites. Plus there is plenty of shopping (normal, not the luxury stuff) right below, & lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. Rooms immaculate. Staff extremely helpful and patient. The breakfast on the 5th floor was always really nice. We went to the rooftop one night and had a bottle of wine and a little picnic up there. Highly recommend if you want to get away from the crowds. It was deserted. Also, the hotel is very quiet. We never heard people in rooms nearby. I only have 2 COMPLAINTS: 1. There is no WIFIi available which the hotel could definitely remedied very easily. 2. You have to climb a flight of stairs with your luggage to get to the front desk. It would be great, especially for elderly folks if they had you leave your luggage at the bottom and offered to bring it up for you. We didn't mind though since we were traveling pretty light. It's a really nice place to come and relax after a busy day sightseeing. I'll definitely go there again if I ever make it back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a good surprise”
Reviews.Author: SherandPat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night in Italy. We were leaving from the airport in the morning and did not want an airport hotel. We picked the Opera Hotel for its location near the train station. What a good surprise. Since this was the lowest price we paid for a room Italy we were not expecting much. The room was good and clean and had a new bathroom. The floors were beautiful marble throughout. The staff was friendly and helpful and got us a car for the next morning's drive to the airport as there was a taxi strike. We were glad we had the car. It was much nicer than the taxi's and was air conditioned. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - extremely helpful staff...”
Reviews.Author: vpgshina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Opera is a great hotel in the heart of rome. The location is extremely convenient and is a walking distance from the train station. There were a host of eating joints next to it and the street , via nazionale is a main street that stays alive till 12 AM. The staff was very helpful , especially Irene who was always willing to help us. The breakfast on the terrace was excellent and again very helpful and friendly staff served us. The rooms were neat and spacious with good amenities and a free internet connection (thru a cable not WIFI). The bathrooms were also of a good size and not the usual small sized holes you get in major cities of Europe. As far as I am concerned it will be THe Opera Hotel again when I travel to Rome. The pictures on the website are the true representation of what you will get.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockieReview
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Lovely room, very clean and comfortable. Pretty good location as you can walk from the hotel to most sites in Rome. Via Nazionale was a little noisy but the windows did a good job of blocking out street noise. Breakfast on the roof was really nice and the service was great. Front desk personnel were very helpful and even gave us a cable for us to access the internet from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: sarah81Cairo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Rome. This is the second time I have stayed at the opera hotel and still find it to be the best value for money and location. The rooms are clean and new, the decor is contemporary and fresh and it is close to everything worth seeing. It was even central to some of the nightlife recommended by the locals. I couldn't believe some of the prices other hotels were charging for lesser quality and further distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel room, moldy shower, frayed exposed hairdryer cord, way overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: kbohnsack
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the web do not really portray an accurate representation of the room we thought we would be reserving. Instead of what we saw on the hotel's website pictures, we arrived to a room that smelled musty, had significant mold in the shower, the built-in hairdryer's cord was frayed with split exposed wires, and no water glasses available. We could have used a candle which probably would have given us as much light in the main room as the installed lights and lamps provided. It was a joke. We immediately went back down to the desk after inspecting the room to inform the hotel attendant that we did not wish to stay at their hotel but were informed that per the hotel policy, if we cancelled without 48 hours notice, we would be charged for 2-night stay. There were no other rooms in the hotel available. We stayed for the 2 nights since they were already going to charge our credit card and then changed hotels. We booked this hotel based on the website pictures and travel advisory reviews. We took pictures and showed them to the hotel desk attendant. She did not appear to be too surprised by the pictures. I would never stay at this hotel again and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our honeymoon in Rome - quiet, well located, modern”
Reviews.Author: chuckynyc
Reviews.Content: Our experience at The Opera Hotel was great -- from all standpoints. My new wife and I just spent four days on our honeymoon at The Opera Hotel in September 2010, on the recommendation of close Roman friends. I speak good Italian and have traveled extensively in Italy, and have stayed in places ranging from fleabag hotels in Palermo to the Danieli in Venice. I also worked at a luxury hotel earlier in my career, so I know what standards are appropriate in nice hotels. The Opera Hotel does not charge expensive room rates, but its standards are definitely on the high end and it overachieves at pretty much everything. It is an exceptional value. At The Opera Hotel, the rooms and common areas were impeccably clean; the service was pleasant, prompt and discreet; the rooms were generously sized and very pleasantly appointed. The hotel is located on the Via Nazionale, a well traveled street close to pretty much all of Rome's attractions -- but the hotel rooms have double-paned glass so the rooms were extremely quiet. (I refer to "rooms" because we stayed in two different rooms, due to my own bungled scheduling of our dates....we changed rooms on the final night, so we were both on the 4th floor initially, and then on the 3rd floor). We slept with no interruptions of any kind. The rooms are all air-conditioned, which can be a life-saver in Rome even into the fall, when the heat and humidity can be high (especially for Americans who are used to A/C and expect it). The hotel could be described as a small, friendly, appealing boutique hotel -- with very attractive, modern, comfortable furnishings and ambiance. One of my pet peeves in Italian hotels in years past has been maids banging around in the hallways in the morning hours, presumably trying to arouse travelers to vacate their rooms so that maids can do their cleaning service in the rooms. This was NOT the case at The Opera, which was quiet throughout our stay. In fact, the hotel only has a few rooms per floor, and although the hotel was fully booked (hence our need to change rooms), I rarely heard or saw anyone in the hallways at all. The hotel serves breakfast on the 5th floor roof terrace, and this is a lovely place to start the day. There are cereal options, croissants, crostata di marmelata options, in addition to juice, coffee, tea and most anything else you would want in the morning. I am trying to think of some shortcomings to mention here....I can think of none. Our stay at the Opera Hotel was a pleasure all-around, and I intend to stay there the next time I get to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from 7 night stay. This hotel...”
Reviews.Author: NikP73
Reviews.Content: Just back from 7 night stay. This hotel is a great location and superb base. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious. Lack of coffee making facilities disappointing and TV signal very poor (only 1 English channel too), neither bothered us as Espresso available everywhere locally and cheap and there's too much to see to worry about TV! Each day we returned to superbly cleaned room. A fridge is in the room offering a minibar and we left our own drinks in here which caused no issues. Bathroom spacious with marble walk-in shower. A few things to mention, the hotel is situated on a main high street between shops, there is no signage on the front door so look for the flags above eye level. Room had excellent airconditioning, which actually proved too good after three days but it can be fully manually operated. Finally the key operates the power so if you need to charge items or you are in your room without the key the power goes off(except airconditioning and fridge). Staff very helpful. Website also links to Roman Candle Tours whom we used for private Vatican tour which was outstanding. Thus hotel is a real gem, perfectly located 10 minutes from train station and tour buses and 10 minutes from Coloseum, Trevi Fountain and the main centre. We didn't have the breakfast package so cannot comment on food however the breakfast area was served on a lovely, but small roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: bellafarfalla
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We arrived at the hotel in the morning and they were able to accommodate our early check in. Upon arrival, we had to bring our luggage up a small flight of stairs to the reception desk however there is a small elevator that took us to the floor where our rooms were located. The building is beautiful with marble staircases and the location on Via Nazionale is ideal and within walking distance to the Termini Train Station, the Piazza della Reppublica, the Trevi Fountain, the Vittorio Emanuele Monument, Colosseum, etc. The rooms are modern with flat screen tvs and a comfortable bed. Our room faced the street but was very quiet at night and we slept well. The bathrooms have great shower heads that apply strong water pressure and the air conditioning is excellent! The rooms also have free Internet which is very convenient. The best part of our stay however was due to a lovely woman working there named Julia. She is amazing, kind, and helpful and makes an amazing cappuccino!!!! The Opera Hotel provides a complimentary breakfast to all of its guests on the balcony and Julia was there every morning to greet us and made us the most wonderful cappuccino to start our day. She also cleaned all the rooms and did an excellent job. We were a group of friends traveling together and she made the same impression on all of us. The front desk was also helpful and Valentina and Tiziana did everything possible to make sure we had a pleasant stay. For the level of service, modern style of room, strong air conditioning, and excellent location we thought it was a great value and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel central to all the sites and an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: elbee139
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this place to us for our recent 4 night stay in Rome and I'd definitely pass on the recommendation to others too. It's quite a small hotel, guessing approx 12 rooms with a lovely roof top terrace for breakfast on the 5th floor, so you start your day away from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. Our room wasn't massive though reasonable by other Rome hotel standards and very nicely set out with designer touches. With the summer in full force outside, the airconditioning and black out curtains were great for a relaxing afternoon siesta or late sleep ins too! Being a small hotel you avoid all the corporate, chain hotel feel though as a result you don't have some of the things you may be used to such as room service or a computers in lobby to use etc. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “understated roman gem”
Reviews.Author: monalinda2010
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel to be very comfortable, cool, quiet, and spottless !!!! while maintaining style and botique ambiance - located perfectly for a travel visit ! close to the train station and an easy walk to most every corner of central rome. staff excellent - without being over bearing. rooms new and exactly as pictured - genourous bathrooms. the bonus is the roof top breakfast terrace! linda and allan R

Reviews.Title: “THE OPERA HOTEL - PERFECT ROMAN HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: kmilena
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from Rome where we stayed 10 days in May. The hotel is absolutely charming. It is in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the centre of Rome. Very close to the Termini Station. About 15 minutes away from Spanish Steps, Colloseum and Capitolini Hill. There is a fairly big grocery store just across the street open until 9 pm. Lots of restaurants and shops just steps away. Hotel is very small and pretty. Rooms quite big for a standard European hotel. Very high ceilings, beautiful bathroom with marble and modern amenities. Lots of hot water, no problems with water pressure, and very clean. Comfortable beds with high end bedding. There's free internet in the room and a mini fridge. One downside is lack of drawers and very small wardrobe space. If you're staying for more than a couple of days, you'll be keeping lots of stuff in your suitcase. The maid service is great and prompt. Very good insulation from the noise of the street.. When you close the window, you can't hear much of anything. Good ventilation system and air-conditioning. The staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. All speak sufficient English. Breakfast terrace is cozy, and very pretty with nice tablecloths, and china. Breakfast itself is simple but sufficient. The menu does not change much. There is toast, jams, honey, butter, fruits, several cereals, croissants, little dinner rolls, 3 types of cakes, cheese and ham and peach/apricot nectar for juice along with another type of juice. Of course there is tea and coffee. Coffee is ether "Americano" or any variety of espresso, capuccino, etc. There is a waitress serving your toast and coffee. The wait staff is wonderful as well. A special thanks goes to Giulia who is a great person and made our breakfasts so enjoyable. The hotel does have a lift (elevator). There are about 14 steps to go up when you enter, and you can get help with your luggage. They also offer a car service to/from airport if you ask. All in all it is a gem of a place and if you are looking for a quiet, cozy, clean, modern hotel with a personal touch - this is the one! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NicG007
Reviews.Content: Our anniversary trip to Rome was made al the more special by a stay in this wonderful hotel. The location was perfect- 10 minutes walk to the Trevi fountain, very close to the main train station. Also, directly across from the tourist information to buy travel cards, and on the main sightseeing bus route, so 5 minutes walk to get on the bus, and right back with the bus to the hotel. Theere are lots of shops close by, the Colliseum is only 15 minutes walk and even the Vatican is only 30 mins away. The room was beautiful, very clean, comfortable beds, great bathroom with bath for those sore feet. The room was cleaned spotlessly every day and the mini bar very reasonably priced and restocked. The Staff were very friendly and very helpful- organized taxis and offered restaurant reservations, and spoke very good English. The breakfast outside was wonderful, and its alo covered if the weather is not so good. All in all- when we go back to Rome- as we inevitably will, we will return to the Opera!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in ROMA!”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Opera hotel for a weekend this past fall. I was actually meeting my husband at this hotel and was able to take the train from FCO Airport to the Termini Railway Station, and was able to walk from there to the hotel. What a great cost savings. A cab is 40E (I think) from FCO to the Center of Rome and I did not want to spend that much, so I did some research with TripAdvisor and found out the train was possible and around 11E. Granted I did not have a large suitcase, so it was pretty easy for me. It’s a cute little boutique hotel. The rooms were a decent size and a very chic look to it. I LOVED the shower! The shower had great water pressure for Europe. There was also a fridge in the room to keep my water and diet soda chilled. The front desk always had someone who spoke English which was a bonus. The location was great. The hotel sits on a major avenue and from this hotel my husband and I walked to every major site in Rome such as; The Vatican City, Coliseum, the Forum and the Trevi Fountain. The balcony on the roof was very nice to go eat breakfast in the morning. They had great fresh pastries. This was a great hotel to explore Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Opera Hotel after a horrible experience at another hotel in Rome (Hotel Cosmopolita.) The staff was EXTREMELY kind and the rooms were amazing. The bed was comfortable, the room was cold (it was 90+ outside), and the bathroom amenities were great. If we ever visit Rome again we will be staying at the Opera Hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Dolce vita a Roma”
Reviews.Author: heinie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff, clean and recently renovated rooms, good location, delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGem50
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Opera Hotel. It was in close proximity to everything including many of the sights and the metro. The room was modern, clean, and quiet. The breakfast terrace was a pleasant way to begin each day. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful with calling taxis and making restaurant reservations for us. The housekeeping/breakfast staff were wonderful! We couldn't ask for more during our first trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: questi0ns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Italy and Rome was our first stop. I read the reviews for this hotel on this and various websites as well as looked at the pictures. Since I had never been before I didn't know what to expect, but I hoped that the pictures were true to fact and they were! My husband and I really liked this hotel. It was very very clean, comfortable, great and helpful hotel staff and great location - within a 5-20 minute walking distance to most of the main sites and the Metro which was about 5 mintues away and we took the Metro to Vatican City. We actually walked everywhere except to Vatican City (did the Metro for only 1 euro each way). Our room opened up to via Nazionale so it was nice to come back and open the windows and just hang out. However, our only complaint was that the air conditioner didn't get as cool as we would've liked it to at night; and we couldn't sleep with the windows open because via Nazionale is a busy street and often a bus would drive by. Other than that we really liked this hotel and would stay there again if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: tjamiga
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a long overdue review of the Opera Hotel. We stayed last Feb 2007. This hotel was recommended to us and was definitely a wonderful hotel in an excellent location. We decided to walk, with luggage, from the train station and only took approximately 10 minutes, not too bad! The hotel was very modern/contemporary, with all the amenties, and a very nice bathroom! Excellent breakfast brought to the room. The hotel staff were very helpful and offered many restaurant recommendations throughout our stay! The rooftop terrace, although closed during our stay, was a nice retreat to have a glass of wine in the evening and view the activity of the street below! There is an excellent supermarket directly across from the hotel. Overall, an excellent hotel in a great location and we will definitely return! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “very good location and very nice interior decor”
Reviews.Author: sandylugano
Reviews.Content: I (female) spent one night at the Opera Hotel in Rom, via Nazionale, and it was really nice. Unfortunately the hotel has only rooms towards the street which is very noisy, but his location is great. If you have heavy luggage you need to climb some steps until you reach the reception, not really nice if you are travelling without man...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Canadian02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to a ton of historical sites. The rooms are very modern and clean and the bathrooms are a far size. There is now an elevator however it is easier to use the stairs. The staff is friendly and helpful. One tip...if you are walking to the location from the train station be aware that the street No.s run 1 - 99 on the left and 99-300 on the right, they do not alternate as they do in North America. We walked right by the hotel. We stayed at the Opera Hotel for the 1st 2 days of our honeymoon and we would highly recommend this property. It is in the perfect location and is small and quaint. Our airconditioning did not work well, but it was not intolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelling81271
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy walking distance to the sights of Rome; less than 1km away from the central train station; and 5min from the closest metro station. A modern hotel, with tasteful decor, clean and tidy rooms, and friendy staff. Breakfast is either served in your room or on the terrace, and although basic is enough to start the day. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definatly stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: sharlachris
Reviews.Content: We could not have been treated nicer or better. After arriving in Rome, our luggage was missing. The nice ladies at the front desk (most notably Alessandria) were most helpfull. They called the airline many times and even submitted our clothing bill after we had to buy clothes. When the luggage finally showed up, it was in our room. The room was very nice, overlooking a very busy Via Nationale. The windows do open and when shut the noise of the street is completely blocked out. The pillows on the bed are perfect and the shower was the best ever..lots of pressure! The in-room breakfast each mornig was just right, and the coffee was an excellent kick-start to a busy day of sightseeing. The elevator is small, but my wife and I were able to ride with all of our luggage (finally). This is a very roomy Hotel when compared to other European hotels. There is a staricase to enter the hotel. However it is not steep, and only ten or so steps. The location is perfectly central to every major sight. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD ABOUT IT.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tdizzle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having looked at possibly every hotel in Rome. We found we were met with loads of chintzy hotels and very expensive. We finally settled on tis hotel. It was without fail the best decision I made in 2006!!!!! It was stunning. We had a gorgeous room, that was very very very well apointed, great views and a brilliant location. The street was busy, but a good busy, more of a hustle and bustle instead of traffic and pollution. It was really central and we walked everywhere. The Termini is just round the corner (5 minute walk) the Trevi is about 10 minutes away and the most breath taking place ever. The Colloseum was about 10-15 minutes walk away, and all the gorgeous piazza's are a stones throw away. The only long walk was the Vatican and St Peters, but it was so close to every where else it was worth it. Its the kind of city to walk in as well so don't get taxis or coaches everywhere. Back to the hotel though, it was ultra clean, modern and very spacious. The staff were bi lingual and very sweet. It was strylish, modern and so special. I would stay there every time I visit Rome and we will be going back. The bathroom was marble and finished to a very high standard as was the decor of the rest of the room. My girlfriend and I absolutely loved our stay there and I couldn't of wished for a better hotel, it made our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Europhile_Pacific
Reviews.Content: Contemporary styling. A flight of stairs at entrance (no elevator). Mostly pleasant and helpful staff at reception. Problem: at night the entrance is locked and guests must be buzzed in. My first night in Rome, I went out for a drink and returned to be left out in the cold and rain for half an hour b/c the doorman was asleep on his cot and did not hear me buzzing. I had to go to a neighbouring hotel where the receptionist gracioulsy phoned the Opera Hotel to have me let in. No compensation was offered to me, despite my complaint the next day. In the single room that I had, the shower is not enclosed; therefore, water splashes all around and the floor needs to be dammed with towels to prevent a minor flood. The breakfast included (7:30-10:30) is not substantial enough to get through the morning. There is free internet access in the room but not wireless and, if you use a Mac, you may have trouble configuring your settings to get a connection. I slept well with earplugs and the bed was comfortable. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: beks999
Reviews.Content: Having not had a holiday this year was really looking forward to a relaxing 4 days in Rome... Oh how wrong can one be! The Opera Hotel is on Via National, one of the main roads in Rome, having said this we couldn't have asked for anything better. The hotel is small, has very friendly staff, is extremely clean and perfect for a city visit. If you want a big hotel lobby to relax in and a bar to have a drink after a long day, then this isnt the hotel for you. However, if you want a trendy room with a good shower, big comfy bed and breakfast-in-bed every morning then book now. It is ideally and centrally located for all the sites , most within walking distance, tho would recommend an open bus tour to get yourself orientated... and you'll get you rest those tooties for a couple of hours! Would recommend this hotel... tho keep your eyes open as it can be easy to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, well priced hotel...”
Reviews.Author: csimco
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two night stay at the Opera Hotel. It is very new and we feel that we were lucky to have found it. The rooms look EXACTLY as the pictures on the website show them to look. Simple, sleek, and modern is the feel, which was nice for a busy stay in Rome. The reception attendants were very helpful and always tried to answer our questions. The maids were also very helpful and very good at their job! Breakfast in bed at no extra charge was a rare and wonderful pleasure. Their pastries were delicious, and the juices were great too. We loved the nuttella on the roll. We hadn't had that before. Our room had a great view of the busy...but not too busy street in front of the hotel. We were able to walk from Roma Termini to the hotel, but we should have gotten a cab since we had so much luggage. We found that the Opera Hotel was in a good position to walk all over, but we utilized the one day travel passes and hopped on and off metros and buses to save our poor little feet. Seeing Rome in two days and nights could be considered attempted suicide, but we made it...almost in one piece. The hotel has no pool, restaurant, etc. which isn't needed. Rome is so big, with so much to see that there really isn't time to hang out at the hotel anyway. If you disagree with that statement, then the Opera Hotel may not be for you, but I believe it is the perfect place to stay if it is a short stay for a first time visitor. If you have any questions about the hotel please email me at video4u@hotmail.com. The website for the hotel is: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Base”
Reviews.Author: CassieJessie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera in September and had a great time. Ignore the bad comments - if you take the hotel for what it explains itself to be - it is excellent. No - there is no bar/ communal areas hence why it is 3 star and not 4 star. However, there is a member of staff on duty 24 hours a day - very helpful staff - nothing is too much trouble. The decor is very modern, rooms very clean, minibar available, beautiful bathroom, very comfortable bed and plasma tv. If you are looking to stay in a hotel to enjoy being pampered, clearly this is not the place for you (nor does it claim to be) but as a base to explore Rome, it is excellent. Breakfast is continental (coffee, tea, croissants etc) and served at a time of your choosing between 0730 and 1030. Certainly - we would stay there again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MagentaC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel at the end of July as we were in Italy on our honeymoon. We were on the top floor (the fourth) and had a magnificent time. We had already stayed in 5 other hotels in Italy and this one was very beautiful and modern. I had the best sleep here! Down duvets and a king size bed - it was heaven! Lots of pillows as well - and they were nice too! I am glad I took the risk booking this despite the lack of reviews. As mentioned, there is no common area but it makes for a nice way to have breakfast - in your room. The service was punctual for breakfast, arriving at our door at the time we requested. The woman bringing the breakfast was very quick and friendly. She delivered the breakfast, put it down and literally ran out as to avoid disturbing us. It was a typical continental - nothing special - but it was breakfast nonetheless. For this matter - I wouldn't recommend coming to this hotel with young children. Also, there are stairs in the walkway coming into the hotel - so it woudn't be manageable with a wheelchair. There is an elevator, so if there are issues physically you don't have to walk to the top floor (although they are small - but that is typically European). The bathroom was beautiful although the shower situation was interesting. There was no shower curtain - only a partial glass -and with the shower head located directly in the middle of the shower area it was awkward to shower and wash hair without soaking the floor. But there was the towel warmer and a bidet. Lots of towels as well. Marble and new - it was just like the pictures you will find on Expedia. The view was nice - onto Via Natzionale and it was quiet despite the fact that it is a main street. There is a balcony but the doors are locked - I think - I couldn't get ours open. To work the safe you have to go to the lobby for the master to set your pin (which is personally changed by each person). Also, you will need to ask them to turn you Air Conditiong on upon acitvating you room. I would stay here again. We were able to set out at 11 in the morning - ltierally walking most of the main areas of Rome and right back to the hotel. From the hotel walking with our suitcases (on wheels) it took 14 minutes and from there the train goes right to the airport. This was a neat find and great for the person looking for something modern, trendy (plasma tv - red chair and black, gray and white decor) and very comfortable. Not a big hotel but very nice. We will definately stay here again when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “The Opera Hotel a Great New Find”
Reviews.Author: cnmiller
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Rome at The Opera Hotel in mid July. This is a new boutique hotel right on via Nazionale nestled between retail stores. The hotel is small, only a hand full of rooms, with narrow corridors and lift. Our family of 4 stayed in a suite which consisted of two adjacent mid-size rooms. The rooms are beautifully furnished in a modern sleek style. The bathroom, though small, contained a marble rain shower, and a heated towel rack. Despite overlooking a busy street, the hotel was extremely quite. There is no dining room, so breakfast is brought to your room every morning at the time of your preference. The staff were very polite and helpful. The location was ideal - walking distance to many of the key sights.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: CA_Gypsy_Girl
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was completely awful. It was extremely difficult to find. No signage and not "700 meters" from Termini Station as stated. Once you do reach it, you have to navigate steep stairs to reach an unimpressive lobby and front desk. Room 204 was completely unacceptable. Only one working small bedlamp in the entire room and the safe did not work. The hallways were dark at night which is extremely dangerous and there was not a peep hole to check who is outside. Worst of all was the bathroom. The pictures on the website made it seem like there was an enclosed tub or at least a shower curtain. Not so. There was a shower head pretty much over the toilet so the entire bathroom became immersed in water with every shower. When asked to switch rooms, I was told they were "working on it". Yup, still working on it up until my check out. This was a two star experience at best and you are better off at a hostel. If you want a great hotel, stay at the Aleph in Rome. It is pricey, but I was wishing I had just paid that money to ensure a truly delightful stay in Rome. I wrote a review about the Aleph for my stay in May 2003. Check it out. I should have heeded my own advice but I was attracted to the price I got on Venere for 100 euro a night. It wasn't worth the headache.
